docs.snippet: "The Godfather" and "Cabaret" led the field with nominations for best in 11 and 10 categories, respectively, in the 45th annual Academy Award sweepstakes announced yesterday in Los Angeles....
docs.lead_paragraph: "The Godfather" and "Cabaret" led the field with nominations for best in 11 and 10 categories, respectively, in the 45th annual Academy Award sweepstakes announced yesterday in Los Angeles.
docs.abstract: Motion Picture Academy of Arts and Sciences on Feb 12 announces nominations for 45th annual Academy Awards; for best picture nominates films The Godfather, Cabaret, The Poseidon Adventure, Deliverance, Sounder and The Emigrants; for best actor nominates M Brando (The Godfather), M Caine and L Olivier (Sleuth), P O'Toole (The Ruling Class) and P Winfield (Sounder): for best actress nominates D Ross (Lady Sings the Blues), C Tyson (Sounder), L Minnelli (Cabaret), L Ullman (The Emigrants) and M Smith (Travels With My Aunt); for best dir nominates B Fosse (Cabaret), F F Coppola (The Godfather), J L Mankiewicz (Sleuth), J Troell (The Emigrants) and J Boorman (Deliverance); for best foreign-language film nominates The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie, The Dawns Here Are Quiet, The New Land, I Love You, Rosa and My Dearest Senorita; for best supporting actress nominates J Berlin (The Heartbreak Kid;, E Heckart (Butterflies are Free), G Page (Pete 'n' Tillie), S Tyrrel (Fat City) and S Winters (The Poseidon Adventure); for best supporting actor nominates J Caan, R Duval and A Pacino (The Godfather), J Grey (Cabaret) and E Albert (The Heartbreak Kid)

docs.snippet: A group of 200 shouting demonstrators succeeded today in preventing a bulldozer and a crew of laborers from going to work at the site of the Kawaida Towers housing project....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of 200 shouting demonstrators succeeded today in preventing a bulldozer and a crew of laborers from going to work at the site of the Kawaida Towers housing project.

headline.main: 200 PREVENT WORK AT KAWAIDA SITE; Bulldozer and Crew Barred by Demonstrators-Police Scored for Inaction Videotapes Viewed Police Move Up

byline.original: By JOSEPH F. SULLIVANSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Grim-faced firemen descended into the fire-blackened chasm of a huge, voicano-like gas tank .on. Staten Island yesterday and labored through the day to recover the bodies of 40 men. burled Saturday in an explosion and fire whose cause remained a m...
docs.lead_paragraph: Grim-faced firemen descended into the fire-blackened chasm of a huge, voicano-like gas tank .on. Staten Island yesterday and labored through the day to recover the bodies of 40 men. burled Saturday in an explosion and fire whose cause remained a mystery.
docs.abstract: firemen on Feb 11 find bodies of 28 of 40 victims of explosion and fire at Texas Eastern Transmission Corp storage tank in SI; remove 26 bodies, all of which were charred beyond recognition; corp officials, who deny knowledge of explosion and hold no gas had been stored in tank for approximately one yr, rept accident caused $31-million in damage; pledge full cooperation with investigations of incident; assert they do not know what caught fire; Fire Dept chief marshall E Sheppard says preliminary investigation has not determined cause of explosion or combustible material that burned in tank for 8 hrs; rules out 'gas leak' as cause; repts workmen were not using open flames or torches of any kind; corp vp R Moore say workmen were repairing tank liner and that work was approved by Fire Dept, who had inspected 3 wks prior to fire to insure appropriate safety measure were in use; Fire Chief J T O'Hagan says mixture of ignitable combustible gases may have exploded or that collapse of tank's concrete dome could have appeared to be explosion; holds incidents stems from repair work

headline.main: 28 VICTIMS FOUND, 12 STILL MISSING IN S.I. EXPLOSION; 3 Safety Inspectors Among 40 in Tank--5 Inquiries Seek Cause of Blast A 10-Month Project 28 Victims Found, 12 A re Still Missing; 5 Inquiries Seeking Cause of S.. Blast

docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.--Walt Disney World is filled with the songs of birds, but the songs come from little green speakers stuck in the ground. There are no pebbles on the custom-made Disney beaches and the water has the tepidity of. a drawn-to-order bath.

headline.main: A Few Words on Disney World: Bad Adjectives, Good Verb--Enjoy; Land of Escape Antiseptic Environment A Few Words on Disney World: Bad Adjectives, Good Verb--Enjoy ... But on a Disney Hotel, They're All Unprintable Progress Report

docs.snippet: IN recent months, London has been in the grip of a virus whose symptoms are rheum and depression, and whose origin is traceable not only to the damp and sunless skies but also to the gray and dismal theater season....
